defs.docs:
The purpose of this library is to provide an OpenGL [`Context`] on as many
 platforms as possible.

attributes.value:
cfg(any
      (target_os = "linux", target_os = "ios", target_os = "windows",
       target_os = "macos", target_os = "android", target_os = "dragonfly",
       target_os = "freebsd", target_os = "netbsd", target_os = "openbsd",
       target_os = "emscripten",))

defs.name: os
defs.docs: Contains traits with platform-specific methods in them.

defs.name: windows
defs.docs: Platform-specific methods for Windows.

defs.name: ContextTraitExt
defs.docs: Platform-specific extensions for OpenGL [`Context`]s.

defs.name: Handle
defs.docs: Raw context handle.

defs.name: raw_handle
defs.docs: Returns the raw context handle.

defs.name: get_egl_display
defs.docs:
Returns a pointer to the `EGLDisplay` object of EGL that is used by this
 context.

defs.name: Context
defs.docs: Represents an OpenGL [`Context`].

defs.name: make_current
defs.docs: See [`ContextWrapper::make_current`].

defs.name: make_not_current
defs.docs: See [`ContextWrapper::make_not_current`].

defs.name: treat_as_not_current
defs.docs: See [`ContextWrapper::treat_as_not_current`].

defs.name: treat_as_current
defs.docs: See [`ContextWrapper::treat_as_current`].

defs.name: is_current
defs.docs: See [`ContextWrapper::is_current`].

defs.name: get_api
defs.docs: See [`ContextWrapper::get_api`].

defs.name: get_proc_address
defs.docs: See [`ContextWrapper::get_proc_address`].

defs.name: build_headless
defs.value: fn (self, el: &EventsLoop, size: dpi::PhysicalSize) -> Result<Context<NotCurrent>, CreationError>
defs.docs: Builds the given GL context.

defs.name: PossiblyCurrent
defs.docs:
A type that [`Context`]s which might possibly be currently current on some
 thread take as a generic.

defs.name: NotCurrent
defs.docs:
A type that [`Context`]s which are not currently current on any thread take
 as a generic.

defs.name: ContextCurrentState
defs.docs:
A trait implemented on both [`NotCurrent`] and
 [`PossiblyCurrent`].

defs.name: RawHandle
defs.docs: Context handles available on Windows.

defs.name: build_raw_context
defs.docs: Creates a raw context on the provided window.

defs.name: WindowedContext
defs.docs:
Represents an OpenGL [`Context`] and the [`Window`] with which it is
 associated.

defs.name: RawContext
defs.docs:
Represents an OpenGL [`Context`] which has an underlying window that is
 stored separately.

defs.name: ContextWrapper
defs.docs:
A context which has an underlying window, which may or may not be stored
 separately.

defs.name: window
defs.docs: Borrow the inner `W`.

defs.name: split
defs.docs:
Split the [`Window`] apart from the OpenGL [`Context`]. Should only be
 used when intending to transfer the [`RawContext<T>`] to an other
 thread.

defs.name: swap_buffers
defs.docs: Swaps the buffers in case of double or triple buffering.

defs.name: get_pixel_format
defs.docs: Returns the pixel format of the main framebuffer of the context.

defs.name: resize
defs.docs: Resize the context.

defs.name: context
defs.docs: Borrow the inner GL [`Context`].

defs.name: make_current
defs.docs:
Sets this context as the current context. The previously current context
 (if any) is no longer current.

defs.name: make_not_current
defs.docs:
If this context is current, makes this context not current. If this
 context is not current however, this function does nothing.

defs.name: treat_as_not_current
defs.docs:
Treats this context as not current, even if it is current. We do no
 checks to confirm that this is actually case.

defs.name: treat_as_current
defs.docs:
Treats this context as current, even if it is not current. We do no
 checks to confirm that this is actually case.

defs.name: is_current
defs.docs: Returns true if this context is the current one in this thread.

defs.name: get_api
defs.docs: Returns the OpenGL API being used.

defs.name: get_proc_address
defs.docs: Returns the address of an OpenGL function.

defs.name: build_windowed
defs.value: fn (self, wb: WindowBuilder, el: &EventsLoop) -> Result<WindowedContext<NotCurrent>, CreationError>
defs.docs:
Builds the given window along with the associated GL context, returning
 the pair as a [`WindowedContext<T>`].

defs.name: ContextBuilder
defs.docs:
An object that allows you to build [`Context`]s, [`RawContext<T>`]s and
 [`WindowedContext<T>`]s.

defs.name: gl_attr
defs.docs: The attributes to use to create the context.

defs.name: pf_reqs
defs.docs: The pixel format requirements

defs.name: new
defs.docs: Initializes a new `ContextBuilder` with default values.

defs.name: with_gl
defs.docs: Sets how the backend should choose the OpenGL API and version.

defs.name: with_gl_profile
defs.docs: Sets the desired OpenGL [`Context`] profile.

defs.name: with_gl_debug_flag
defs.docs: Sets the *debug* flag for the OpenGL [`Context`].

defs.name: with_gl_robustness
defs.docs:
Sets the robustness of the OpenGL [`Context`]. See the docs of
 [`Robustness`].

defs.name: with_vsync
defs.docs: Requests that the window has vsync enabled.

defs.name: with_shared_lists
defs.docs: Share the display lists with the given [`Context`].

defs.name: with_multisampling
defs.docs:
Sets the multisampling level to request. A value of `0` indicates that
 multisampling must not be enabled.

defs.name: with_depth_buffer
defs.docs: Sets the number of bits in the depth buffer.

defs.name: with_stencil_buffer
defs.docs: Sets the number of bits in the stencil buffer.

defs.name: with_pixel_format
defs.value: fn (mut self, color_bits: u8, alpha_bits: u8) -> Self
defs.docs: Sets the number of bits in the color buffer.

defs.name: with_stereoscopy
defs.docs: Request the backend to be stereoscopic.

defs.name: with_srgb
defs.docs: Sets whether sRGB should be enabled on the window.

defs.name: with_double_buffer
defs.docs: Sets whether double buffering should be enabled.

defs.name: with_hardware_acceleration
defs.docs: Sets whether hardware acceleration is required.

defs.name: CreationErrors
defs.docs: We received multiple errors, instead of one.

defs.name: CreationError
defs.value: CreationError::{OsError, NotSupported, NoBackendAvailable, RobustnessNotSupported, OpenGlVersionNotSupported, NoAvailablePixelFormat, PlatformSpecific, Window, CreationErrors}
defs.docs: Error that can happen while creating a window or a headless renderer.

defs.name: OsError
defs.docs: General platform error.

defs.name: ContextError
defs.docs: Error that can happen when manipulating an OpenGL [`Context`].

defs.name: OpenGl
defs.docs: The classical OpenGL. Available on Windows, Linux, OS/X.

defs.name: OpenGlEs
defs.docs: OpenGL embedded system. Available on Linux, Android.

defs.name: WebGl
defs.docs: OpenGL for the web. Very similar to OpenGL ES.

defs.name: Api
defs.docs: All APIs related to OpenGL that you can possibly get while using glutin.

defs.name: Compatibility
defs.docs: Include all the immediate more functions and definitions.

defs.name: Core
defs.docs: Include all the future-compatible functions and definitions.

defs.name: GlProfile
defs.docs: Describes the requested OpenGL [`Context`] profiles.

defs.name: Latest
defs.docs: Request the latest version of the "best" API of this platform.

defs.name: Specific
defs.docs: Request a specific version of a specific API.

defs.name: GlThenGles
defs.docs:
If OpenGL is available, create an OpenGL [`Context`] with the specified
 `opengl_version`. Else if OpenGL ES or WebGL is available, create a
 context with the specified `opengles_version`.

defs.name: GlRequest
defs.docs:
Describes the OpenGL API and version that are being requested when a context
 is created.

defs.name: to_gl_version
defs.docs: Extract the desktop GL version, if any.

defs.name: GL_CORE
defs.docs:
The minimum core profile GL context. Useful for getting the minimum
 required GL version while still running on OSX, which often forbids
 the compatibility profile features.

defs.name: NotRobust
defs.docs:
Not everything is checked. Your application can crash if you do
 something wrong with your shaders.

defs.name: NoError
defs.docs:
The driver doesn't check anything. This option is very dangerous.
 Please know what you're doing before using it. See the
 `GL_KHR_no_error` extension.

defs.name: RobustNoResetNotification
defs.docs:
Everything is checked to avoid any crash. The driver will attempt to
 avoid any problem, but if a problem occurs the behavior is
 implementation-defined. You are just guaranteed not to get a crash.

defs.name: TryRobustNoResetNotification
defs.docs:
Same as [`RobustNoResetNotification`] but the context creation doesn't
 fail if it's not supported.

defs.name: RobustLoseContextOnReset
defs.docs:
Everything is checked to avoid any crash. If a problem occurs, the
 context will enter a "context lost" state. It must then be
 recreated. For the moment, glutin doesn't provide a way to recreate
 a context with the same window :-/

defs.name: TryRobustLoseContextOnReset
defs.docs:
Same as [`RobustLoseContextOnReset`] but the context creation doesn't
 fail if it's not supported.

defs.name: Robustness
defs.value: Robustness::{NotRobust, NoError, RobustNoResetNotification, TryRobustNoResetNotification, RobustLoseContextOnReset, TryRobustLoseContextOnReset}
defs.docs:
Specifies the tolerance of the OpenGL [`Context`] to faults. If you accept
 raw OpenGL commands and/or raw shader code from an untrusted source, you
 should definitely care about this.

defs.name: None
defs.docs: Doesn't do anything. Most notably doesn't flush.

defs.name: Flush
defs.docs:
Flushes the context that was previously current as if `glFlush` was
 called.

defs.name: ReleaseBehavior
defs.docs: The behavior of the driver when you change the current context.

defs.name: PixelFormat
defs.value: PixelFormat { hardware_accelerated, color_bits, alpha_bits, depth_bits, stencil_bits, stereoscopy, double_buffer, multisampling, srgb }
defs.docs: Describes a possible format.

defs.name: color_bits
defs.docs: The number of color bits. Does not include alpha bits.

defs.name: multisampling
defs.docs:
`None` if multisampling is disabled, otherwise `Some(N)` where `N` is
 the multisampling level.

defs.name: PixelFormatRequirements
defs.value: PixelFormatRequirements { hardware_accelerated, color_bits, float_color_buffer, alpha_bits, depth_bits, stencil_bits, double_buffer, multisampling, stereoscopy, srgb, release_behavior }
defs.docs: Describes how the backend should choose a pixel format.

defs.name: hardware_accelerated
defs.docs:
If true, only hardware-accelerated formats will be considered. If
 false, only software renderers. `None` means "don't care". Default
 is `Some(true)`.

defs.name: color_bits
defs.docs:
Minimum number of bits for the color buffer, excluding alpha. `None`
 means "don't care". The default is `Some(24)`.

defs.name: float_color_buffer
defs.docs:
If true, the color buffer must be in a floating point format. Default
 is `false`.

defs.name: alpha_bits
defs.docs:
Minimum number of bits for the alpha in the color buffer. `None` means
 "don't care". The default is `Some(8)`.

defs.name: depth_bits
defs.docs:
Minimum number of bits for the depth buffer. `None` means "don't care".
 The default value is `Some(24)`.

defs.name: stencil_bits
defs.docs:
Minimum number of stencil bits. `None` means "don't care".
 The default value is `Some(8)`.

defs.name: double_buffer
defs.docs:
If true, only double-buffered formats will be considered. If false,
 only single-buffer formats. `None` means "don't care". The default
 is `Some(true)`.

defs.name: multisampling
defs.docs:
Contains the minimum number of samples per pixel in the color, depth
 and stencil buffers. `None` means "don't care". Default is `None`.
 A value of `Some(0)` indicates that multisampling must not be enabled.

defs.name: stereoscopy
defs.docs:
If true, only stereoscopic formats will be considered. If false, only
 non-stereoscopic formats. The default is `false`.

defs.name: srgb
defs.docs:
If true, only sRGB-capable formats will be considered. If false, don't
 care. The default is `false`.

defs.name: release_behavior
defs.docs: The behavior when changing the current context. Default is `Flush`.

defs.name: GlAttributes
defs.value: GlAttributes { sharing, version, profile, debug, robustness, vsync }
defs.docs: Attributes to use when creating an OpenGL [`Context`].

defs.name: sharing
defs.docs: An existing context with which some OpenGL objects get shared.

defs.name: version
defs.docs: Version to try create. See [`GlRequest`] for more infos.

defs.name: profile
defs.docs: OpenGL profile to use.

defs.name: debug
defs.docs: Whether to enable the `debug` flag of the context.

defs.name: robustness
defs.docs: How the OpenGL [`Context`] should detect errors.

defs.name: vsync
defs.docs:
Whether to use vsync. If vsync is enabled, calling `swap_buffers` will
 block until the screen refreshes. This is typically used to prevent
 screen tearing.

defs.name: map_sharing
defs.docs: Turns the `sharing` parameter into another type by calling a closure.
